H0.text: The Linnaean system is the name of the system that consists of a hierarchy of taxa, from kingdom to species.

H1.text: Bohr's law is the name of the system that consists of a hierarchy of taxa, from the kingdom to the species.

H2.text: Mendelian system is the name of the system that consists of a hierarchy of taxa, from the kingdom to the species.

H3.text: Zoology is the name of the system that consists of a hierarchy of taxa, from the kingdom to the species.

A4.text: Linnaean taxonomy is a general term for ranked classification of organisms.

A5.text: Linnaeus established three kingdoms, each divided into classes, and the classes divided into lower ranks in hierarchical order.
